items.title: MoRTH launches all-India mission to clear NH encroachments using drones, apps
items.summary: Encroachment removal will take place under the Control of National Highways (Land and Traffic) Act, relevant rules, and the August 7, 2025 SOP, with support from local administration where needed.

items.title: Cipla launches Ciplostem cell therapy for Knee Osteoarthritis in India
items.summary: Ciplostem is a single-dose intra-articular injection designed to work at the cellular level to reduce inflammation, relieve pain, improve joint mobility and preserve cartilage.

items.title: Jyoti Global Plast launches AeroCrop drone for precision agriculture
items.summary: Offers up to 29 minutes of flight time without payload and 22 minutes with payload

items.title: Flipkart reports strongest growth in years; festival users cross 200 million
items.summary: A key driver was Flipkart’s zero-commission policy for products below ₹1,000, boosting MSME competitiveness and seller participation.

items.title: IFFCO MD commends soft launch of ‘Bharat Taxi’ in Delhi, Gujarat
items.summary: Under the innovative cooperative model, drivers receive 100 per cent of the fare, along with dividends and a share in the profit

items.title: Putin to address India’s trade gap while securing key deals
items.summary: Senior Russian Ministers, top businesses to offer opportunities for exports in pharma, medical device, technical textiles, food products, automobiles, workers’ mobility

items.title: Haryana RERA directs Chintels to refund homebuyer’s money with interest
items.summary: Haryana RERA has ordered builder Chintel to refund a buyer Rs 1.7 crore with 10.85% annual interest. The buyer sought a refund after the Chintel Paradiso housing society partially collapsed in February 2022. The authority also awarded Rs 2 lakh for mental agony and Rs 50,000 for litigation costs.

items.title: Life insurance industry on a curve of redesigning for faster growth: Generali Central Life MD&CEO Alok Rungta
items.summary: Says awareness of the need for protection is not deep yet, but Covid-19 helped health insurance come to the forefront

items.title: Spotify’s top 5 songs of 2025 skip Arijit Singh entirely
items.summary: Spotify's 2025 Wrapped reveals Arijit Singh as India's most-streamed artist for the seventh year, though his songs didn't top the charts. "Raanjhan" by Sachet-Parampara claimed the most-streamed song title, highlighting romance's continued popularity. The data showcases a blend of enduring voices and current trends in Indian music.

items.title: A concert shaped by conscious choices: Ben Böhmer lights up Gurugram
items.summary: Seagram’s 100 Pipers hosted a Ben Böhmer concert at Leisure Valley, Gurugram, integrating sustainability into the event. The 'Play for a Cause' initiative featured waste segregation, recycling, composting, and meal redistribution. An art installation made from discarded materials symbolized the cause, demonstrating how music and environmental responsibility can coexist.

items.title: SEBI eases access for low-risk foreign investors with new SWAGAT-FI window
items.summary: The new system unifies registration across FPI and FVCI routes, reduces documentation, and extends registration validity to 10 years from the present 3–5-year model.

items.title: Kashmir’s prized saffron faces crisis as dry spell deepens
items.summary: Official data shows Pulwama and Budgam —the two major saffron-producing districts — have recorded a sharp rainfall deficit between October 1 and December 3, 2025

items.title: Not losing sleep over falling rupee against dollar, expects improvement next year: CEA
items.summary: India's Chief Economic Adviser V Anantha Nageswaran remains optimistic despite the rupee's decline against the US dollar, projecting a rebound in the coming year. The government is poised for a significant surge in foreign direct investment, aiming to exceed $100 billion this year.

items.title: Meesho IPO: Issue received solid response on Day 01, booked 2.46 times on strong retail interest
items.summary: Meesho Ltd's IPO, backed by SoftBank, showed strong demand on its first day, with bids exceeding 66 crore shares. The subscription reached 2.46 times, led by retail investors at 4.11 times. The IPO aims to raise  ₹5421 crore for various purposes, including technology and marketing.

items.title: Force Motors reports a 59% growth in domestic wholesales in November
items.summary: Traveller, the company’s flagship people-mobility platform, continues to anchor volumes with steady consistency and healthy year-to-date growth

items.title: Markets extend losing streak as rupee slumps, small-and mid-caps hit badly
items.summary: The Indian rupee’s depreciation to a record low of 90.14 against the US dollar in early trade, eventually closing at 90.19, emerged as the key concern dampening investor sentiment

items.title: Zoho’s medtech firm vTitan to accelerate medical device launches in next one year
items.summary: Company has also launched vCardio, an AI-powered cardiac monitor

items.title: Daiwa Securities invests Rs 285 cr in Ambit’s wealth management arm
items.summary: Third strategic investment by the Japanese financial group in as many years. Infusion of primary capital will help to launch new products, tap global footprint of each other and attract talent. Wealth management contributes 40% of Daiwa’s global revenues.

items.title: IndiGo to restore normal flight ops over next 48 hours after network disruptions hit 200+ flights
items.summary: IndiGo is working to fix flight disruptions. The airline expects operations to return to normal within the next 48 hours. Schedule adjustments are being made to improve punctuality. IndiGo is offering passengers alternative travel or refunds. The disruptions were due to several factors including technology and weather.

items.title: Improving affordability, rising incomes power strong momentum in India’s housing market
items.summary: India's residential real estate sector is experiencing a robust phase, driven by rising incomes, improved affordability, and government support. Despite past challenges, housing sales are strong, with annual sales in leading cities reaching 3-4 lakh units. Favorable interest rates and credit expansion further bolster the market's positive outlook.

items.title: Lok Sabha passes Central Excise (Amendment) Bill ahead of GST cess phaseout on ‘sin goods’
items.summary: New laws are set to tax tobacco and pan masala products.  These bills replace the GST compensation cess.  Excise duty will be levied on tobacco items.  A health and national security cess will apply to pan masala.  This ensures high taxation on these goods continues.  The government aims to repay loans and end the compensation cess soon.

items.title: Arun Singh gets one-year extension as ONGC chief
items.summary: Arun Singh's tenure as ONGC chairman is extended by one year. His leadership has stabilized crude production and improved gas pricing. ONGC has seen healthy profits and a significant share price increase. The company is now focused on cost optimization to manage soft crude prices. This strategic move aims to protect margins and sustain investor returns.

items.title: Iran’s currency falls to a new low as nuclear sanctions squeeze its ailing economy
items.summary: The new low of 1.2 million rial to the U.S. dollar is increasing pressure on food prices and other costs

items.title: India to update national accounts base year to 2022–23; new data effective from February 26–27, says Nirmala Sitharaman
items.summary: India is updating its economic data framework. The base year for national accounts will change from 2011-12 to 2022-23. This revision will happen next year. The move aims to better reflect the current economy. It addresses concerns raised by an international report. The new base year will provide more relevant economic statistics for the nation.

items.title: IndiGo cancels scores of flights from Bengaluru, Hyderabad airports amid crew crunch; airline cites ‘technology issues’
items.summary: Scores of IndiGo flights were delayed or cancelled at several airports over the past few days, as the airline struggled to get the crew to operate its flights.

items.title: Birla Estates ties up with Sikka group for a residential project in Greater Noida
items.summary: Birla Estates Private Limited has partnered with an NCR real estate developer as a co-developer for a 5-acre residential project in Greater Noida. This collaboration, backed by a new Uttar Pradesh government policy for stalled projects, will see Birla Estates invest Rs 500 crore to develop a project with an estimated gross development value of Rs 1,600 crore.

items.title: Pan masala packs must now display retail price, says govt
items.summary: New rules will require all pan masala packages to show the Retail Sale Price and other details. This change starts on February 1, 2026. Small packs, previously exempt, will now also need these labels. The move aims to protect consumers by ensuring clear pricing. It will also help in collecting Goods and Services Tax accurately on all pan masala sales.

items.title: AISATS begin ground handling at Cochin International Airport
items.summary: The launch brings future-ready technology, globally benchmarked safety systems, and sustainable ground handling solutions to one of India’s most strategically important aviation hubs

items.title: Russia's Sberbank seeks to boost imports, labour migration from India after Putin's visit
items.summary: Russia's Sberbank is boosting trade with India, focusing on imports and skilled workers. The bank is facilitating deals with over 6,000 Indian firms new to Russian trade. Payments are being made in national currencies, bypassing sanctions. Russia seeks to increase bilateral trade to $100 billion. India's IT, pharma, and machine-building sectors are highlighted.

items.title: Excise duty to ensure tax incidence on tobacco remains same after GST cess ends: Sitharaman
items.summary: “Since the GST law caps maximum rate of tax at 40%, the ultimate tax incidence on tobacco after removal of GST cess would come down from the current level if excise duty is not levied,” said the Finance Minister

items.title: DoCA mandates declaration of retail price on all pan masala packs from February 1
items.summary: The Ministry said this will ensure clear pricing information and facilitate the effective implementation of RSP-based GST levy on pan masala

items.title: BEML gets Rs 414 crore top-up order from Bangalore Metro for six more trainsets
items.summary: The latest order is an extension of Contract 5RS-DM, originally awarded to BEML in August 2023 after competitive global bidding. The base contract, valued at approximately Rs 3,177 crore, includes the design, manufacturing, supply, installation, testing, commissioning, and comprehensive maintenance of the metro trainsets for up to 15 years.

items.title: At 3.9 mn, Jio led India's active subscriber add tally in October
items.summary: India's active subscriber base surged by 5.7 million in October, marking the strongest monthly growth in five months. Reliance Jio led the gains with 3.9 million new subscribers, followed by Bharti Airtel, while Vodafone Idea experienced a slight decline. This robust subscriber momentum is expected to positively impact average revenue per user.

items.title: Central banks continued buying gold in October despite soaring prices, says WGC
items.summary: But, purchases during January-October were lower compared with the same period over the past 3 years

items.title: IndiGo flight chaos: Pilot shortage causes massive delays, cancellations
items.summary: The bottleneck follows the rollout of the second phase of Flight Duty Time Limit norms coinciding with winter schedule expansion from November 1

items.title: Apraava Energy secures Rs 800-crore funding
items.summary: Apraava Energy is the country's leading integrated energy solutions provider headquartered in Mumbai. It is jointly owned by the CLP Group -- one of the largest investor-owned power businesses in Asia and La Caisse (formerly CDPQ), a global investment group.

items.title: Apraava Energy secures $92 million from British International Investment, Standard Chartered
items.summary: This transaction demonstrates the partnership between two UK institutions, channelling commercial and development finance capital into a key sector for India’s energy transition journey

items.title: Despite tax short-fall, Govt on track to meet fiscal deficit and CAPEX targets: PwC India
items.summary: India's government is set to achieve its fiscal deficit and capital expenditure goals. Strong non-tax revenues and early spending are supporting this. Nominal GDP growth may be slightly lower than predicted. Private investment is still cautious due to global and domestic uncertainties. Upcoming GST data will reveal consumption trends.

items.title: India's smartphone export to US triples to $1.47 bn in Oct
items.summary: India's smartphone exports to the US have surged over threefold to $1.47 billion in October, defying global challenges. Cumulatively, exports to the US reached $10.78 billion from April to October, a significant jump from the previous year. This robust growth, despite tariff uncertainties, highlights India's strategic advantages and increasing integration into global supply chains.

items.title: Pernod Ricard India bets big on Xclamat!on; sharpens premium push after Imperial Blue sale
items.summary: The new multi-category launch — spanning whiskey, brandy, rum, vodka, and gin — will play a key role in strengthening the company’s presence in southern markets, said Jean Touboul, CEO

items.title: Sun Pharma unit to invest Rs 3,000 cr on new plant in Madhya Pradesh
items.summary: Sun Pharmaceutical Industries' subsidiary, Sun Pharma Laboratories Ltd, has approved a Rs 3,000 crore investment for a new greenfield formulations manufacturing facility in Madhya Pradesh. This significant expansion by the Mumbai-based drug major aims to bolster its production capabilities. The announcement comes as Sun Pharma's shares saw a slight increase on Wednesday.

items.title: Stock markets drop for fourth day amid relentless foreign fund outflows; Sensex dips 31 points
items.summary: The 30-share BSE Sensex dipped 31.46 points or 0.04% to settle at 85,106.81 and the 50-share NSE Nifty skidded 46.20 points or 0.18% to 25,986

items.title: Vodafone Idea jumps 4.34% amid AGR relief speculation
items.summary: However, the company clarified via stock exchanges that it has no fresh development beyond disclosures made in October 2025 and November 2024 regarding Supreme Court orders.

items.title: A solar glut is building in India. Can the industry withstand China-style pain?
items.summary: According to estimates from Wood Mackenzie, India’s solar module manufacturing capacity will exceed 125GW by 2025, which is more than three times its domestic demand. The pain of oversupply could force consolidation, separating the men from the boys.

items.title: Mint Explainer | How Air India blundered by missing a routine airworthiness review for an aircraft
items.summary: India's aviation regulator is probing Air India for flying an Airbus A320 without a valid Airworthiness Review Certificate. The airline has acknowledged the error, suspended eight employees, and initiated an internal investigation.

items.title: Rupee hits ₹90/dollar as economy awaits U.S.-trade deal
items.summary: May not be a cause of worry as it could support exports in the backdrop of a tariff, say experts

items.title: Layoffs part of 2024 workforce rationalisation process: Zee on recent downsizing reports
items.summary: The move will help the company arrive at a cost-effective operational model

items.title: Not losing sleep over falling rupee against dollar: CEA
items.summary: The rupee plummeted to a new low of 90.30 against the dollar in the intra-day session on Wednesday

items.title: Rupee breaches 90/dollar for first time; falls 25 paise to close at all-time low of 90.21
items.summary: Uncertainty over the India-US trade deal, along with the lack of Reserve Bank of India (RBI) effort to stop the slide in the local unit, put further pressure on the rupee, according to forex traders

items.title: Swiggy shares rise 0.80% ahead of $1.1 billion fundraise next week
items.summary: The food and grocery delivery platform has shortlisted three banks to manage the share sale: Citigroup, JPMorgan Chase, and Kotak Mahindra Capital, reports say

items.title: Mint Explainer | India just approved its first scent trademark—here’s what it means for brands
items.summary: By accepting a rose fragrance on tyres as a trademark, India has entered the era of sensory IP protection. But who stands to gain?

items.title: India weight-loss market reset? In setback for Novo Nordisk, Dr Reddy's Lab allowed to make semaglutide
items.summary: The order follows the court’s view that Novo Nordisk’s patent appears prima facie invalid -- a finding that could reshape competitive dynamics in a market valued at around Rs 850 crore.

items.title: Apis India sets record date for 24:1 bonus; shares lock at upper circuit
items.summary: The bonus shares are expected to be credited around December 8.

items.title: Aequs eyes higher value aircraft parts as Airbus supplier launches IPO
items.summary: The company launched a $102.4 million initial public offering that was fully subscribed within hours of opening on Wednesday and is eyeing a valuation of up to $923.5 million

items.title: Vizhinjam port crosses 1 million TEUs in 10 months, fastest in India
items.summary: Developed by Adani Ports and the Kerala Government, the port handled 615 vessels, including 41 ultra-large container ships over 399 metres — the most at any Indian port

items.title: Google’s new virtual try-on lets Indian shoppers see outfits on themselves just by uploading a photo
items.summary: Indian users can now try on billions of apparel listings on Google with a new AI-powered tool that simulates how outfits drape and fit on real body shapes.

items.title: Tatkal ticket booking at railway counters to now need OTP verification
items.summary: To make Tatkal ticket booking more foolproof, the Railway Ministry has announced that Tatkal ticket booking will now require OTP verification at the reservations counters. This new system aims to stop agents from misusing the facility. Passengers will receive an OTP on their mobile number provided in the form. Ticket confirmation depends on successful OTP verification.

items.title: Mint Explainer: Why are quick commerce platforms selling cosmetics for  ₹1?
items.summary: Higher margins on these products are only part of the reason. &nbsp;

items.title: Apple plans a folding smartphone. Samsung is going one better.
items.summary: Apple is reported to be planning its first foldable smartphone in 2026 but Samsung has a more dramatic innovation in mind.

items.title: AI turns vintage tracks into fresh revenue streams for music labels
items.summary: Music labels are leveraging AI to enhance content catalogues, creating videos for audio tracks without visuals. This approach reduces costs by up to 70% and aims to maximize reach on platforms like YouTube, while ensuring the integrity of original art is maintained.

items.title: Gold imports drive India's CAD to 1.3% in Q2 FY26: Analysts
items.summary: According to assessments by Crisil, ICICI Bank Research and Emkay Global, the merchandise deficit expanded as gold imports surged nearly 150% quarter-on-quarter, touching USD 19 billion in Q2, while goods exports declined on a sequential basis following the rollout of higher US tariffs on Indian shipments.

items.title: Install emission monitors by December 31 or face closure, Centre warns Delhi-NCR industries
items.summary: The Central Government also directed Delhi-NCR states to finalise their 2026 air pollution control plans within this month

items.title: Power sector proposals brighten India’s energy outlook but lasting gains need a stronger jolt of reforms
items.summary: India’s legislative proposals should help stabilize the power sector and unlock efficiencies. But we’d still need state-level regulatory autonomy and a clear structural separation of supply and network businesses. Let’s aim to attract private investment.

items.title: Manufacturing drives record demand across industrial & logistics real estate
items.summary: India's industrial real estate market is experiencing a surge driven by manufacturing's demand for sophisticated, compliant, and future-ready facilities. Leasing of light manufacturing space has jumped seven-fold since 2020, with Grade A assets now dominating. This trend highlights a strategic shift towards leased, automation-ready infrastructure to boost speed-to-market and operational efficiency.

items.title: India may allow e-ambulance manufacturers to import traction motors fitted with rare earth magnets till March
items.summary: India's push for e-ambulances under the PM E-drive scheme highlights the urgent need for localized production of critical components. Experts believe that this initiative will not only enhance service efficiency but also strengthen the domestic supply chain.

items.title: Remember when IndiGo claimed it was ‘On Time, Every Time’? Not anymore
items.summary: India’s largest airline is facing headwinds in its once-wonted punctuality performance.

items.title: Manipal Hospitals said to file $1 billion IPO in January
items.summary: The company is targeting a valuation of as much as $13 billion, the people said, asking not to be identified because the information is private

items.title: Government removes the mandate for Sanchar Saathi
items.summary: The government has reversed its decision to make the Sanchar Saathi cyber safety app a mandatory pre-installation on all new smartphones sold in India. This move follows strong opposition from technology and handset manufacturers. The app, designed to combat fraud and unsolicited calls, has seen significant user adoption.

items.title: Rupee at 90: How and why it became worst-performing major currency
items.summary: The Indian rupee is now the worst-performing currency among emerging and advanced economies this year as trade tensions, widening deficits, and foreign outflows drag it down to record lows against the US dollar.

items.title: FMCG raw material costs a mixed bag; cereals prices softens but coffee remains firm: Report
items.summary: Softening of crude oil will aid in lower packaging costs for FMCG companies

items.title: Resonia signs MoU with Amber Wings to deploy advance heavy lift drone technology
items.summary: The immediate roadmap focuses on developing and deploying drones with a 200 kg payload, incorporating swarm technology and autonomous tower erection.

items.title: Airbus faces a growing A320 glitch that may shake confidence in the skies
items.summary: Airbus is dealing with a manufacturing flaw in its A320 jets. This issue affects hundreds of aircraft, including those in production and already flying. India, with its large A320 fleet, is particularly exposed. Inspections and potential repairs could delay deliveries. Airbus has identified the problem and contained it, but the full impact on operations is still being assessed.

items.title: Govt removes mandatory pre-installation of Sanchar Saathi App amid Oppn's 'snooping' claims
items.summary: The Centre has withdrawn its directive mandating the pre-installation of the Sanchar Saathi cyber safety app on smartphones following privacy concerns raised by the Opposition. The government stated the app is solely for cyber protection and users retain full control, emphasizing its role in citizen participation against digital fraud.

items.title: Govt to extend social security benefits to 100 core workers by March 2026 as against 94 crore now: Mansukh Mandaviya
items.summary: Speaking at the IndiaEdge 2025, organised by the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII), on Wednesday, labour and employment minister Mansukh Mandaviya said India’s social security coverage has increased from 19% in 2015 to 64.3% in 2025, an unprecedented 45 percentage point surge over the past decade. The target is to extend social security benefits to 100 crore by the end of 2025-26, second only to China which provides social security to 107 crore workers, he said.

items.title: Centre releases ₹109 crore for Vellore, Neyveli and Salem airports under UDAN
items.summary: Tamil Nadu has been awarded 68 UDAN routes, with 26 operational so far

items.title: RBI approves Vikram Sahu's appointment as Bank of America's India CEO — Details here
items.summary: India's banking regulator, the RBI, has approved Vikram Sahu's appointment as the CEO of Bank of America's India operations, as the veteran now moves to succeed Kaku Nakhate. Nakhate will now assume the role of Chair, India.

items.title: Novo Nordisk India partners with Healthify to launch AI-enabled patient support programme
items.summary: Novo Nordisk India and Healthify have launched a new programme. It offers AI-assisted lifestyle guidance for people with obesity. This partnership aims to improve patient experience and treatment results. An AI assistant will help users track nutrition throughout their treatment journey.

items.title: 91Springboard signs leases for new hubs in Bengaluru and Chennai, expands South India footprint
items.summary: 91Springboard is expanding its South India presence by adding two new flex-workspace hubs in Bengaluru and Chennai, totaling over 1 lakh sq. ft. and nearly 2,500 seats. These new centers, set to open by February 2026, underscore the company's commitment to meeting rising demand from enterprises and startups in the region.

items.title: JFE to invest ₹15,750 cr in JV with JSW to run Bhushan Power, target 10 MT steel capacity by 2030
items.summary: JFE Steel and JSW Steel have formed a joint venture to operate Bhushan Power & Steel Limited (BPSL), marking a significant overseas investment in India's steel sector. JFE will invest ₹15,750 crore for a 50% stake in JSW Kalinga Steel, aiming to boost BPSL's capacity to 10 million tonnes by 2030 and meet India's growing steel demand with value-added products.

items.title: Megacities are both booming and increasingly exposed to the risk of disastrous floods
items.summary: The world’s fast-growing megacities are mostly in Asia and Africa—a tropical belt that’s at high risk of floods as global warming increases atmospheric moisture and makes downpours that much likelier. Yet, there’s no stopping rapid urbanization.

items.title: Guwahati’s massive 6-lane Brahmaputra bridge nears completion; set to cut travel time sharply
Dollar set for ninth straight loss as traders eye Fed outlook; euro rises, yen falls
items.summary: Trump’s sway over Fed policy remains in focus

items.title: NephroPlus set to launch IPO open on Dec 10; eyes ₹353-cr via fresh issue
items.summary: The IPO is a combination of a fresh issue of shares aggregating up to ₹353.4 crore and an Offer For Sale (OFS) of 1.12 crore shares by the selling shareholders

items.title: Uday Kotak urges Indian firms to step up as rupee crosses 90 and foreign investors dominate markets
items.summary: The Indian Rupee is nearing 90 against the US Dollar. Foreign investors are selling Indian stocks, impacting market performance. Domestic investors are buying, but foreign selling is currently dominant. This situation calls for Indian businesses to adapt. Export-oriented sectors may benefit from the weaker Rupee, while import-dependent sectors face increased costs.

items.title: Not losing sleep over falling rupee, says CEA after currency breaches 90-level
items.summary: The falling rupee is not affecting inflation or exports, he said on the sidelines of CII event here

items.title: upGrad trims losses sharply in FY25 even as revenue growth slows
items.summary: While growth has cooled sharply compared to previous years, the company has managed to significantly improve its bottom line. upGrad's net loss shrank 51% to  ₹273.7 crore, compared to  ₹559.9 crore in FY24.

items.title: Labour codes likely to be fully operational from April 1, govt to pre-publish draft rules soon
items.summary: The four labour codes - Code on Wages, 2019, Industrial Relations Code, 2020, Code on Social Security, 2020 and the Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020 - were notified on November 21.

items.title: Furlenco raises ₹125 cr from Sheela Foam, others to accelerate expansion
items.summary: Furlenco eyes IPO in coming years

items.title: RBI approves appointment of Vikram Sahu as CEO of Bank of America, India operations, says internal memo.
items.summary: Sahu will replace Kaku Nakhate who served the bank as CEO for about 15 years. Vikram will report to Jin Su, president of Asia Pacific.

items.title: Ola Electric deploys 250-member taskforce to clear service backlogs, signals major after-sales overhaul
items.summary: The team comprises technicians and operational specialists led by the core leadership team, to clear pending repairs and improve spare-part availability for the company's fast-growing electric scooter base

items.title: IndiGo cancels over 70 flights due to crew shortages; airline says tech issues, airport congestion hit ops
items.summary: IndiGo has cancelled over 70 flights and experienced widespread delays due to acute crew shortages following the implementation of new flight duty time limitation norms. The airline's on-time performance has significantly dropped, impacting operations across the country as it grapples with increased rest periods and restricted night landings.

items.title: Vidya Wires IPO books 1.78x on day 1
items.summary: The retail investor segment led the subscription with 2.47 times oversubscription, followed by non-institutional investors at 1.89 times; QIBs remained cautious, bidding for only 0.47 times

items.title: Ola Electric deploys 250-member taskforce to clear service backlogs, signals major after-sales overhaul
items.summary: Ola Electric has launched a major nationwide service overhaul, deploying a 250-member rapid-response team to clear repair backlogs and improve after-sales support for its growing electric scooter fleet. The team—comprising technicians and operations specialists and guided by senior leadership—has nearly resolved service delays in Bengaluru and will expand the model to other cities.

items.title: As AI roils shares of India's largest IT firms, their share in Sensex falls to lowest in 18 years
items.summary: The weight of IT services stocks in the benchmark BSE Sensex has dropped to 11.3%, the lowest in 18 years, as the rise of AI and &nbsp;an uncertain growth outlook make investors wary. Analysts believe this is a potential investment opportunity, expecting growth recovery from 2026.

items.title: Electric tractor tech company Moonrider secures $6 m in Series A funding
items.summary: The investment was led by pi Ventures with additional participation from Singularity AMC, along with existing investors Advantedge Founders and Micelio Fund

items.title: Skewed pilot planning forces IndiGo to cancel 200 flights; airline issues apology
items.summary: Simmering discontent among pilots over hectic rosters out in the open; airline says it is making adjustments to its schedules to restore normalcy

items.title: India's Chief Economic Advisor Nageswaran says govt is 'not losing sleep over Rupee weakening'
items.summary: After the rupee weakened beyond the key psychological level of 90 per dollar, Chief Economic Advisor V. Anantha Nageswaran said he is not concerned, noting that the currency’s slide is not affecting inflation or exports.

items.title: The new AI workforce: How AWS is betting on agents to run the enterprise of the future
items.summary: Amazon Web Services (AWS) CEO Matt Garman’s message was simple and strategic: agents are not a flashy consumer gimmick; they are the next utility that enterprise workflows will depend on

items.title: Indian Gas Exchange board decides to go public for raising funds
items.summary: According to a regulatory filing, the Board of Directors of IGX Ltd has approved to start the process of Initial Public Offering (IPO) of the equity shares of face value of ₹10 each

items.title: For a sustainably higher growth path, India mustn’t just mobilize more labour and capital but deploy them more efficient
items.summary: India has recorded GDP growth that makes Viksit Bharat status look reachable, but a closer look reveals that capital deepening has weakened while productivity has been stagnant. This presents a challenge for policymakers who must work out how to push up the economy’s growth trajectory.

items.title: BEML bags fresh contract worth ₹414 cr from BMRCL for supply of additional trainsets
items.summary: The new contract comes as part of the ongoing efforts to expand the city's metro network and increase urban connectivity

items.title: Delivery of Tripundra project to strengthen liquidity for realty developer TARC
items.summary: Launched in FY2023 and being completed in FY2026, Tripundra showcases TARC’s ability to deliver high-specification, design-driven residential projects with precision, speed and disciplined financial management.

items.title: NBCC gets Rs 643 cr contract from Ghaziabad Development Authority
items.summary: NBCC Limited has secured significant new projects. The company will undertake project management consultancy for the redevelopment of Tulsi Niketan in Ghaziabad. NBCC also won contracts for constructing new buildings for the Institute of Company Secretaries of India in Kanpur and Lucknow.

items.title: IndiGo, SpiceJet flights delayed as tech outage affects check-in system at airports — What we know
items.summary: Flights from airlines, including IndiGo and SpiceJet, were reportedly delayed on 3 December amid a tech outage, which affected airports' check-in systems. Here's what we know.&nbsp;

items.title: Ex-Flipkart executive Jeyandran Venugopal named CEO of Reliance Retail Ventures
items.summary: Former Flipkart executive Jeyandran Venugopal joins India’s largest retailer to lead Reliance Retail Ventures, as the company strengthens its leadership ahead of an IPO.

items.title: Policymakers count the costs as rupee breaches 90/dollar barrier: Here is what could be in store for India now
items.summary: Rupee record low: The big question now, more than anything else, seems to be one of stability. The key is to watch whether these near-term pressures will settle or persist. items.title: Stock Market Highlights today December 2, 2025: Sensex tanks nearly 504 pts, Nifty slips to 26,032 on selling in bank stocks, Reliance
items.summary:
Sensex, Nifty, Share Prices Highlights: Stock markets declined on Tuesday, with the benchmark Sensex tumbling nearly 504 points due to selling in blue-chip bank stocks and Reliance Industries, and persistent foreign fund outflows.

Falling for the third straight session, the 30-share BSE Sensex tumbled 503.63 points or 0.59 per cent to settle at 85,138.27. During the day, the benchmark tanked 588.9 points or 0.68 per cent to hit a low of 85,053. The index had scaled a record high level in intra-day trade in the previous session, but closed lower due to profit booking in the second half.
